question: A year younger than I was for my first.
answer: When can I have a stag?

question: a stag?
answer: Oh come on! Why would they join up against the Irish?

question: Because someone has to stand up to them.
answer: You?

question: Me, Marke, all the tribes. We cant resist alone.
answer: I could.

question: Oh my little warrior. We have to be careful. Come home without something for your Lady there will be hell to pay.
answer: Can I?

question: You will love it. You found a trapdoor? Alright Simon, will you tell us all how you found it?! Look at that!
answer: Where does this lead?

question: Youll see. I like that vase, I think I'll have that. I always knew the Castle was built on Roman foundations but we didnt think anything was left!
answer: Must be a burial crypt or something.

question: Here we are
answer: Who else knows about this? Good.

question: Of Cornwalls next tribute I want slaves. Young ones. Their future. If Marke resists have Morholt crush him.
answer: My King.

question: Morholt.
answer: I have led your armies to victory far and near. Iv made you rich and powerful.

question: Yes you have. You have been most loyal.
answer: When I return from Cornwall, I was hoping...

question: What would please you?
answer: A wife.

question: Its dark in an hour.
answer: What do you think is really out there?

question: Britannia. The old Roman lands. Full of evil and grief.
answer: I want to see it. Do you know what the future looks like Bragnae?

question: I see the life you were meant for. Your father will speak with you.
answer: Am I just a chattel to be traded at your pleasure? Do I have no say in my own life?

question: Your father has given you the news? And you welcome it?
answer: I accept it.

question: You know, we are more alike than you might guess.
answer: How so?

question: I too dabble in elixirs. Poison from the livers of a puffer fish. Just a taste paralyses all the senses. So if the blade doesnt kill...
answer: Rendered safe by thistle and bark.

question: And you know the antidote for this?
answer: Yohimbine.

question: When would you strike?
answer: At once. Throw everything we have at them.

question: They are hoping you'll do that. On horse they outnumber us two to one. You would lead the men straight to their deaths.
answer: So we do nothing?!

question: Simon!
answer: Tristan!

question: I cant feel my legs or my hands.
answer: Poison.

question: Build a second boat.
answer: Tristan!

question: Where are we going?
answer: Away.

question: You're afflicted child. Speak to me! Your father will find us and have my head. You are my charge. Please!
answer: I am no ones charge!

question: You are. And you will be Morholts Lady!
answer: And live a loveless life like my mam?

question: Whats that?
answer: Where?

question: Isolde. Wait! Dont! Isolde. Dont! Isolde!
answer: Its a man.

question: Dead?
answer: Alive! Bragnae help me!

question: Isolde?
answer: Help me! Start a fire! Quickly! His heart falters.

question: What are you doing?
answer: He needs heat. Now! Get your clothes off! Quickly! Hurry! Quickly! Smell that? Smell the poison? When he warms we will need thistle and bark.

question: Ive not been naked with a man for 15 years!
answer: Hello. You've been sleeping a long time. You're in Ireland. Did you know that? Shh... It's alright. You're safe here. No one knows. Don't be scared. Just sleep... sleep.

question: Nooo Nooo Noo!
answer: Its alright, you dont need that! I forgot to tell him about you...

question: Youve been away.
answer: I had noticed. Yes I have a bit.

question: Where?
answer: Bragnae and I were spying the convent of Brittes ].

question: Seeking sanctuary?
answer: Some women need it.

question: Youll find no refuge in a new religion. Your place is here, with Morholt.
answer: Any word of my betrothed?

question: What's your name?
answer: Oh, I think it's better if we don't bother with names.

question: How can I thank you if I don't have your name?
answer: You just did. If you insist... my name is Bragnae. I'm a lady in waiting at the court. My parents are dead. My mother, she is the source of the kindness you find so puzzling. My father would've left you where you fell.

question: Tristan of Aragon.
answer: Well Tristan of Aragon, I'd guess about you too, but I think I've already seen everything.

question: She likes me. Shes right though, you do risk.
answer: There. What of your parents?

question: They also died when I was a child.
answer: Of what?

question: A different type of Irish kindness.
answer: Sorry. Tomorrow then?

question: Tomorrow.
answer: There she who bore you brought you forth.

question: Ridiculous.
answer: I happen to believe what that says. Dont you think there is more to life?

question: Than what?
answer: Something more than duty and death! Why are we capable of feelings if not to have them? Why long for things if they are not meant to be ours? Well dont listen to me. Youre so sure of things. Youre certainty, its like armour. I wish I had that.

question: Why would you need it?
answer: The joy of being a lady? Wanting something I cant have. A life of my own.

question: Youre promised?
answer: Yes.

question: Whats he like?
answer: Dark. Tall. Nearly twice your size. An absolute gentleman.

question: I thought... earlier when you spoke of wanting something you cant have.
answer: I didnt know what I was talking about. Outside, just past that bluff there is a boat. Thats how you should go when you leave. You should go soon.

question: How do you feel?
answer: I dont know Tristan! Theyve found your boat. At this very moment the King himself is scouring the coast. He will find you. He finds everyone. The tide is coming lets go!

question: Come with me. Come with me!
answer: I cant

question: Why not? Please!
answer: Tristan, weve both known this cant be. Weve known this from the start. That doesnt mean it isnt true. It is. It just cannot be. I want to know that you are alive somewhere thinking of me from time to time. I want to know that there is more to this life and I cant know that if they kill you. Please? Go!

question: A Cornish warrior may be ashore. Beware. We seek him as I speak. Hopefully it is just his rotted corpse we'll find, for he has slain your betrothed. Morholt is dead. Fallen in battle. Isolde? Bragnae, comfort her.
answer: Shes stunned.

question: As am I by her grief.
answer: We should assulat the British straight away. Crush them with maximum force.

question: Maximum force. Like that of Markes tribe with the maximum force you speak of? I will not confront them again until our numbers are refreshed. Until then, well have cunning divide them.
answer: Of what nature?

question: What?
answer: It is the only way to keep the alliance alive.

question: I fail to see how fighting with our partners keeps us allies.
answer: Well they are all going to the tournament anyway. By announcing you will share the dowry with every Baron that remains loyal and in turn offering to support whomever prevails, the others would be compelled to follow you when you win.

question: If we win. If we lose we could end up following Wictred. Id need an infallible champion!
answer: Me.

question: You are not yet healed.
answer: Then this trip will be my tonic. I will be ready. I know I will.

question: What is the source of this fervour?
answer: Let me go and win you a wife. She can make peace without spilling one drop of blood, and maybe heal a wound from which you still lack.

question: You risked your life to give me to another man.
answer: You said your name was Bragnae. Why did you do that?

question: Oh what have I done? Stop this thing. Say something.
answer: I can't. I won you in my King's name.

question: But I am yours. You touched me and I yielded...
answer: It doesn't matter.

question: It is the only thing that matters Tristan. Leave with me, I will go anywhere.
answer: Your marriage will end a hundred years of bloodshed.

question: My marriage to another man!
answer: Isolde. You will live with this. We must.

question: Perhaps someone his own age should speak with him. They believe you are distant. They are worried about you. So am I.
answer: I can tell. Laughing at the market, holding hands, a caress on the neck when he pours you wine.

question: He is my husband. I remember his Kingdom comes before my life.
answer: Yes well, I must confess I thought you might find more difficulties in performing your duty.

question: Am I not permitted a single moment without mourning? Living with this Tristan as you said we must.
answer: I live in torture thinking of these moments. With every look he gives you I get sicker and sicker. There is a burning in me, I feel on fire and guilt and I can't get rid of either. Does it make you happy to know that?

question: Welcome bands of Anglia, Rothgar and Orick. Wessex
answer: As you will be King and his daughter Queen, does that mean Donnchadh will be coming to the coronation.

question: It does. On the next full moon, all will attend.
answer: A lot can happen in a month

question: Bearing that in mind, and given the instabilities of our new land I shall be naming a second. My sister has raised one, capable of guiding you if the need should arise. He is a man of passion, fierce in battle who has learnt to tame his heart with his head. I give you Tristan of Aragon. For the first time since the Romans, this country stands united.
answer: I cant be your second. Melot must be. He is blood. Besides, I wish to journey north.

question: You no longer sleep at Dor, and now you dont want to be my second. Do you find no comfort in your home? These stone walls that you helped build?
answer: I find these walls a prison.

question: Why?
answer: Everything I want seems misplaced.

question: Ever since you were a boy you sacrificed everything for me. All for one dream. Now that you reached that dream, it is natural that you would feel some loss. It doesnt matter if you want to be second. You are. I will only be king if you are my second. Id put it more gently if I could.
answer: Then I am your second.

question: Perhaps it is time that you took a wife!
answer: No!

question: Cant live alone forever.
answer: I can!

question: Tristan, I need to speak with you.
answer: Go ahead.

question: We havent even had a coronation yet to mark tradition. But now he breaks tradition and scares all the barons by naming you as second.
answer: I tried to convince him you would be better.

question: Yes well, peace can be just as treacherous as war and I feel that Marke doesnt really...Listen to me!!! Our attention must be on Cornwall now more than ever.
answer: I am sorry he didnt choose you. I am.

question: What do you think became of them?
answer: They were lives... just lived.

question: I find myself imaging things in this place. I decorate it. Books, a harp there... a child.
answer: Would it be his or mine?

question: Then dont. There is a servings child, quite ill. Doing better now.
answer: I didnt ask you were you were. Your heart is beating so fast.

question: Is it?
answer: Isolde. Is there anything I can do to make you happier. I want to make you happy.

question: Shes in love with Tristan. Theyre intimates. If I expose them it will break Markes heart and his hold on the other Barons.
answer: How?

question: With Markes champion in chains, well take Castle Dor. You can man your armies unopposed. There will be no one defending you in the waters.
answer: And your price?

question: I want Markes throne.
answer: When his throne falls apart, well go over and pick up the pieces.

question: Tristan? Can I speak with you? Is it possible... do you think a man blinded by love... Is it possible that that man might not see treachery right in front of him?
answer: No.

question: Perhaps you could follow her. I cant ask anyone else. I know. I know what you think  Im acting like a child. Normally I can read faces, but with hers I feel like... I can't be objective. Shes so delicate.
answer: You really love her.

question: Oh... I do...terribly. I didnt know how empty I was. She sustains me, she thrills me. And when I see this ring, it is a ring of thorns.
answer: The ring is nothing. She's loyal to you. I am sure of it.

question: You bring an entourage?
answer: I can let myself be alone in my position Lord Marke. But dont worry, they will stay offshore. I miss you.

question: My nephew, Merlot of Cornwall
answer: And Tristan, slayer of my best general, winner of Isolde, defender of the alliance. You are a fortunate man.

question: I miss Ireland
answer: Isolde, this must end.

question: Thats like asking me to stop breathing.
answer: It cannot be.

question: Its all been coming apart. I can feel it
answer: There is very little time. Fortunately, Donnchadh has no quarrel with anybody here. Hes asked me to give you a message.

question: Whats this?
answer: It is compensation for the men you will lose attacking Castle Dor with Donnchadh tomorrow. Lets be honest, our people need a stronger leader.

question: And who might that be, Wictred?
answer: Melot. Too long the ablest amoung us has been denied his rightful place. I pledge you my legiance and offer him my services as his second.

question: I told him about Ireland. Hes given us our freedom. Why does loving you feel so wrong?
answer: Get in.

question: Tristan, if I do this.
answer: For all time, they will say it was our love that brought down a kingdom. Remember us.

question: You.
answer: What happened here?

question: A reward for idiocy. A dozen Irish have blazed your way.
answer: Melot, I came to aid Marke.

question: Everyone lies.
answer: I didnt lead them here.

question: No, I did.
answer: Why?

question: I thought someone believed in me.
answer: It will be undone.

question: TristanIm for the wormsswear to me that you are true.
answer: As we were brothers.

question: Hurry!
answer: Bring her.

question: Marke, you must come, the battle needs you. Well lose everything.
answer: I must heed their call, I am the King.
